basics.name: Jinning Wang
basics.label: PhD Student
basics.summary: Currently pursuing a Ph.D. degree in electrical engineering at the University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN, USA. Research interests include data mining, scientific computation, and power system modeling. Author of the power system dispatch simulator AMS and coordinator for the CURENT Large-scale Testbed development.

work.name: University of Tennessee Knoxville
work.summary: Involved in various projects, including the CURENT Large-Scale Testbed, Cyber-Physical Dynamic System Modeling, and research on the economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on electricity consumption.

work.name: University of West Florida
work.summary: Assisted in teaching duties while pursuing a Master of Science in Data Science.

publications.name: Electric Vehicles Charging Time Constrained Deliverable Provision of Secondary Frequency Regulation
Electricity consumption variation versus economic structure during COVID-19 on Metropolitan Statistical Areas in the US
Virtual Inertia Scheduling (VIS) for Real-time Economic Dispatch of IBRs-penetrated Power Systems
Disturbance Propagation in Power Grids With High Converter Penetration

projects.name: CURENT Large-Scale Testbed
projects.summary: Coordinating the development of the CURENT Large-scale Testbed, focusing on power system dispatch simulation and analysis.

projects.name: Cyber-Physical Dynamic System Modeling
projects.summary: Modeling and validation of electric vehicles for secondary frequency regulation, contributing to AGC services.

references.name: Prof. Fangxing 'Fran' Li
references.reference: James W. McConnell Professor at the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, University of Tennessee Knoxville. Contact: fli6@utk.edu
